column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples of Li1+xZn2ô€€€yMo3O8 were pre- pared by modifying a previously reported solid-state-reaction method [13].
#Text=The starting materials are Li2MoO4 (99+%), ZnO (99.9%), MoO2 (99.9+%), MoO3 (99.9+%) and Mo(99.9%).
#Text=Three dierent modi\fcations in the solid-state- reaction procedure were tried in the present study.
#Text=In the following they are referred to as procedure Ref (almost the same procedure as reported in Ref. [13]), procedure A, and procedure B.

#Text=Assuming that the occupancy of the disordered Li and Zn sites could be controlled by increas- ing Li2MoO4 while decreasing ZnO, we varied the nominal composition as Li : Zn :Mo:O = (1+w) : (2:8ô€€€w) : 3 : (8:6+ \), where w = 0.4 and \ = 0 (procedure Ref ), ô€€€0:3 \ w \ 0:3 and \ = 0 (procedure A) or ô€€€0:45 \ w \ ô€€€0:2 and \ = 0:175 (procedure B).
#Text=A mixture of the Li2MoO4, ZnO, MoO2, and Mo powders with the above molar ratio was used as the initial material for the solid-state-reaction for procedure Ref and procedure B.

#Text=For procedure A MoO3 is additionally used with a molar ratio of MoO2:MoO3 = 3:2 in addition to the Li2MoO4, ZnO, and Mo.Except for ZnO and Li2MoO4 which were dried at 160 \C before using, all the starting chemicals were used as received.
#Text=The mixture of the chemicals was grinded, pelletized, and put into an Al2O3 crucible which was then evacuated and sealed in a quartz tube.

#Text=For most of the solid-state-reactions the heat-treatment sequence started with a 100 \C/h ramp to 600 \C, followed by a 24 h wait, before ramping up with 10 \C/h to the \fnal temperature of 1050 \C.
#Text=After keeping the \fnal temperature for 12 h, the reaction vessel was quenched into water.

#Text=The \fnal temperature of 1000 \C instead of 1050 \C was used for two samples: procedure A with w = 0 and procedure Ref .A regrinding and second reaction sequence were done only for procedure Ref , otherwise only one reaction se- quence was performed.
#Text=As the \fnal step, the reacted pow- der was washed with 3M HCl and rinsed with pure water several times to remove unreacted ingredients.
#Text=Almost all procedure A had a small and procedure B a large amount of secondary phase which was identi\fed as non-magnetic Zn2Mo3O8.

#Text=As a reference for the non-magnetic secondary phase, a polycrystalline sample of Zn2Mo3O8 compound was also separately synthesized as previously reported in Ref. [13] and con\frmed to be indeed non-magnetic by measuring it's magnetic susceptibility.
#Text=Inductively coupled plasma (ICP) mass spectroscopy (Arcos EOP, Spectro) was used to determine the elemen- tal ratios of Li, Zn, and Mo of the obtained powder sam- ples.

#Text=Three standard solutions with Li : Zn :Mo concen- trations in ppm units as 0 : 0 : 0, 0.508 : 10.04 : 20.06 and 1.016 : 20.08 : 40.12 were measured so that the data could be evaluated on a calibration curve using the variance-
